intro: Chaenorhinum gamezii, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are typically tubular with five lobes and are pollinated by nocturnal insects such as moths. Chaenorhinum gamezii is well-suited to harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
